question: What is Grimstad?

content.source_1: Grimstad (town) Grimstad () is a town in Grimstad municipality in Aust-Agder county, Norway. The town is also the administrative centre of the municipality. It is located on the Skaggerak coast in Southern Norway along the Groosefjorden, between the towns of Arendal (to the northeast) and Kristiansand (to the southwest). The town has a population (2016) of 12,552 which gives the town a population density of . Grimstad Church is located on a small hill overlooking the town's harbour. The University of Agder is located in the town as well. The village of "Grømstad" existed for a long time as
content.source_2: Grimstad Church Grimstad Church () is a parish church in Grimstad municipality in Aust-Agder county, Norway. It is located in the town of Grimstad. The church is part of the Grimstad parish in the Vest-Nedenes deanery in the Diocese of Agder og Telemark. The large, green, cruciform church was built in 1881 using plans by the architect Henrik Thrap-Meyer. The church is one of the largest wooden churches in Norway, seating about 1,000 people. It is also the location of the "Bibelskolen in Grimstad (BiG)", a private Lutheran bible school. The University of Agder has its faculty of engineering seated here. A student dorm called "Grøm" is also in Grimstad. Grimstad is a coastal municipality in Aust-Agder county bordering on the Skagerrak. Grimstad Township, Roseau County, Minnesota Grimstad Township is a township in Roseau County, Minnesota, United States. The population was 190 at the 2000 census. Grimstad Township bears the name of John Grimstad, a Norwegian settler. According to the United States Census Bureau, the township has a total area of , all of it land.
